course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Themes in Literature: Love and Death
course.description: This course concentrates on the themes of love and death in literature and on ways these themes are handled by various writers from a comparative perspective. Reading materials are primarily poems and short stories. Excerpts from selected novels may also be included. In addition to guiding students to examine literary texts closely, this course also explores the relationship between studies of literature and other disciplines, such as psychology and philosophy. Topics include the construction of subjectivity, gender and sexuality, ethics of desire, self and society, and the meaning of existence.

reviews.author: cckwan
reviews.title: 中唔中意 見仁見智
reviews.comment_content:
我中學係讀全理4x
未接觸過文學野
呢個course 全部係詩詞, 文章文學
但唔知點解對我來講好有趣
原因係因為個instructor 好interactive, 佢教學唔係一味講model answer, 好鼓勵你表達自己睇到呢首詩既感覺同分析
特別係love and death呢個topic 幾中意, 覺得幾inspire到自己作進一步既自我反省

見到有個review話nds係呢科冇乜優勢
都幾認同
去到discussion好明顯聽得出港陸既思想分別好大
nds會好傳統, 好固執於某D舊思想:
例如我果年個nds discussion係print左成本書咁厚既notes
每講一句都會話: 乜子曾經講過, 乜子又講過 所以我地要跟住
但港生通常會有D free d既idea出來, creative少少
而且睇得出個Prof幾buy呢類creative既discussion
(creative但唔係天馬行空, 自己斟酌下)
reviews.comment_teaching:
個instructor 好interactive, 佢教學唔係一味講model answer, 好鼓勵你表達自己睇到呢首詩既感覺同分析
而且冇死記硬背 final同discussion同係分析/長題目
冇背野
reviews.comment_grading:
我third hon
呢個course應該係我暫時拎過既第2高grade: B
唔多需要努力(same as i always do)
只係你個人中意諗野, 中意深層次既諗野
應該都幾輕鬆
reviews.comment_workload:
感覺上冇野做
佢派D readings我都係上堂先睇
最大workload應該係要上堂睇一套電影, 成2個鐘
全程訓, 之後要上網睇返brief

reviews.author: fsw
reviews.title: Interesting Course
reviews.comment_content: The content included some poems and short stories, two movies were also included. This course suits students who really like literature. The content overall was interesting, because the themes "love" and "death" are something related to life, it definitely raised a lot of thoughts. There were also two lessons for discussion, students could freely express their opinions, just like friends chatting in a big group, very thought-provoking.
reviews.comment_teaching: The Prof always encourage students to answer her questions, and she could give in-depth analysis for the poems and stories. She is quite a nice prof, she is willing to answer questions from students.
reviews.comment_grading: I didn't do much revision, given that I attended all lectures, the questions in the midterm and the final were all essays, students could choose to answer in chi or eng, it was quite free. Attendance is important. I got A range at last.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light, just attending the lectures, no project, no assignment. If the lecture talks about poem, not much preparation is needed, the prof will explain it well. But if the lecture talks about short story, better read it before the lesson, or else you will feel lost for the whole lecture.

reviews.author: Abcalan
reviews.comment_content: 全部係文學野, 有興趣先好黎讀, 無就唔好浪費時間.
reviews.comment_teaching: prof 好友善, 上堂唔悶,
reviews.comment_grading: 爛grade.. final 無出分但係mid term 高過mean最後得b range. 有attendance 同participation 分, 一走堂就會無左呢d分
reviews.comment_workload: 基本上0 workload, 只需要上堂前睇睇文章就可以, mid term 和 final 都係唔係好需要溫

reviews.author: CTK
reviews.comment_content:
midterm(poem given)
徐志摩: 〈偶然〉; 〈丁當－清新〉
鄭愁予:〈錯誤〉；〈情婦〉
夏宇:〈也是情婦〉;〈甜蜜的復仇〉;〈愛情〉
Elizabeth Barrett Browning, “If Thou Must LoveMe”;“How Do I Love Thee?”
Robert Browning, “Meeting at Night”
John Collier, “The Chaser”
Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress(112min)
Her(126min)

final(open note):
W. H. Auden, “Stop All the Clocks, Cut off the Telephone”
Pablo Neruda, “A Dog Has Died”
Ernest Hemingway, “A Clean Well-Lighted Place”
村上春樹(Murakami Haruki),〈有熨斗的風景〉
村上春樹，〈青蛙老弟，救東京〉
渡邊淳一(Watanabe Jun’ichi), 〈自殺的建議〉
reviews.comment_teaching:
mostly in English, sometime Mandarin
discussion is encouraged
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance: 15%
Participation in class and group discussions: 15%
Midterm exam: 30%
Final exam: 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
zero
even no need to review for exam

reviews.author: 邦
reviews.comment_content:
對於未上過文學堂嘅人
呢個係個唔錯嘅選擇
因為內容唔太深 都係愛情同生命嘅課題
佢嘅文學選材亦唔曲高和寡 有村上春樹或者徐志摩

只要勇於發表喺堂上發表自己同聽人地嘅意見同感受
會發現自己原來可以思考咁多嘢或者人地嘅說話係幾有啟發性
reviews.comment_teaching:
堂上多數都係分享為主
所以TEACHING方面唔係太多
反而係佢會引導我地點樣欣賞文學
對於讀SBM嘅我係幾有趣而覺得新奇嘅

另外堂上變相有好多我地自己分享睇法嘅部分
可以放心嘅就係廣東話國語英文都係無任歡迎
reviews.comment_grading:
ATTENDANCE好重要！！！

因為只係MIDTERM+FINAL+ATTENDANCE
而MIDTERM同FINAL都係以ESSAY揀題目作答
所以分數嘅RANGE唔係太大

ATTENDANCE只係簽ATTENDANCE SHEET
所以其實叫朋友幫手簽係唔難嘅
只係GROUP DISCUSSION真係無得走喇

不過我就建議都係上足啲堂好啲
因為佢CANVAS擺嘅資料只係LITERATURE嘅COPY
換言之你要上堂先知佢教嘅方向係邊度
有時用課程當中嘅篇章作嘅比較就難啲GOOGLE搵到

最後呢科班NDS係無優勢嘅
反而喺GROUP DISCUSSION裡面會聽得出香港人比較有SENSE
reviews.comment_workload:
WORKLOAD可以話係零
無功課無ESSAY無PRESENTATION

可能只係上堂前要睇定啲LITERATURE
但係放心唔識睇嘅GOOGLE已經有大把導讀
其中課程當中有三次GROUP DISCUSSION
有一個係上堂睇戲然後再分享自己感受
另外兩次就係自己睇文章

課程只係有一個MIDTERM同FINAL
然後課程內容唔係CUMULATIVE
所以要溫嘅篇章亦唔算多（~6-8篇）

reviews.author: ianlau
reviews.comment_content:
This course concentrates on the themes of love and death in literature and on ways and the cultural milieu in which writers have handled these themes. It is the aim of this course to guide students to approach literature as a form of entertainment and enlightenment. We will study not only canonical works of “high” literature but those of popular literature as well. For students who wish to learn the interpretive strategies and understand the thematic significance of literary texts, this course provides guidance to both aesthetic appreciation and recognition of psychological and philosophical issues raised in literature. Readings are primarily poems and short stories. We will also watch some films and discuss the relation of film and literature in terms of these themes. Topics include the construction of subjectivity, gender and sexuality, self and society, and the meaning of existence in the modern world.

Half of the readings are in Chinese. Students are expected to have a reading ability of Chinese. The course will be conducted in English.



λ Class attendance. Attendance is absolutely essential to this course. Absences exceeding one allowance will result in a lower grade.
λ Participation. Students should prepare the required reading before each lecture and actively participate in class as well as in group discussion.
λ Midterm exam. Essay questions.
λ Final exam. Essay questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment:
• Attendance: 15%
• Participation in class and group discussions: 15%
• Midterm exam: 30%
reviews.comment_workload:
mid-term exam
final exam
discussion
Attendance
reading
No Presentation
No Quiz and project
